Posts.Content: JillW wrote: I had surgery a little over a year ago. Did fine until 2 weeks after the surgery and the breast only swelled apparent lymphedema which has never gone away.  Finally my Harvard surgeon dx as lymphedema not any other of my 8 doctors had diagnosed it and I didn't know I hadn't heard of LE in the breast only.  I was at the point where I was going to ask for the breast to be removed.  There was no excuse for this.  Finally after the dx I began tx with my PT with a Certified Lymphedema Therapist on the second tx I could already begin to noticed and improvement.  She is very involved with the medical community here and tries to educate them that this is a big problem. I've been searching for compression specialty bras and have only found two that are made to fit and have pouches to hold different sizes of compression devices. Sports bra's just don't cut it with my severity.  My ? is does anyone know of sources for quality bra's? The Bellisse bra meets all the needs and Anita bra 2nd. Price $100 - $200 and is not covered by my Medi-care or State Medi-cal programs.  Legislature is working on this.  For a bra comparison chart you can got to bellisse.com/comfort_bra/comparison.shtml. Thank you for any resources info anyone may have. JillW Dx 11/11/2006, ILC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast/Trunk Lymphedema JillW sccruiser

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2008 01:48PM JillW wrote: Hi Bunny,  I think I got the info.  I down loaded and printed about 8 pages because they all looked interesting at first glance.  It is so nice to have others in the same boat with you.  I felt I was just about the only one that had lymphedema in the breast. thanks again, JillW

Thanks, Jill

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2008 01:45PM JillW wrote: Hi Tina: I have a source for the Ballisse bras my therapist recommended to me.  "Family Drug" 1805 Old Sonoma Road, Napa, Ca  94559  (707) 224-7807   www.familydrug.com  their selling them for $120.  not out to make money just good people. And now that you've been fitted it should be easy. I haven't got one yet waiting to see how small I get for a good fit. Thanks, JillW
